page.title: 07Nercwys & Eryrys - Wildlife.
page.content: Because the area is reasonably unfrequented by traffic and humans in large numbers, there are numerous birds and small animals. There are many hedgerow birds, woodland birds such as jay, owl and nuthatch also moorland birds such as plover, curlew and pheasant. There are many small mammals, mice of many kinds and grey squirrels, some of which are surprisingly red in colour. There is a considerable and fluctuating rabbit population and there are many foxes. Badgers are present but are decreasing in numbers even though the living conditions are ideal. This is due to the activities of badger diggers from the cities and the fact that some landowners consider that the badgers are vermin.
